intro: Oenothera delessertiana, commonly known as the Delessert's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths. Oenothera delessertiana is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
